WRITING.TEXT: Bring back Ellie Sattler, too! Then we'd have the Dream Team all back together. :)
You can never escape from /r/PrequelMemes.
I would totally be down for a show about that badass African warlord dude and his people hunting down aliens in the aftermath of Independence Day. Netflix, get on that!

Man, this show continues to fire on all cylinders. Loved all the Trump references. I felt really bad for Ward - I'm really hoping that this version of him will come into our reality (and bring Tripp, too, please!).

I know a lot of people give the T-Rex in San Diego sequence shit, but I fucking loved it. It legimately terrified me as a child, too (I had nightmares as a result). That sequence alone is better than the entirety of the 1998 American Godzilla film.
Plus, the scene with the trailer and Julianne Moore on the glass is fucking aces.

Loved the Trump reference with Bakshi and the furniture place. Lol
It would be hilarious if Trump somehow finds out about this show and their anti-Trump references and angrily tweets about it.
Must go faster...must go faster!

I'm officially super fucking excited for the Jurassic World sequel now. What with this news and his role in Thor: Ragnarok, it's a good time to be a Goldblum fan.
Possibly unpopular opinion: even though the movie was silly and dumb as hell (and much worse than the original film), Goldblum was by far the best part of Independence Day: Resurgence. He even had the funniest one liner of the film, IMO: "Are we really going to wait for the dog?" as the massive alien queen approaches.

WRITING.TEXT: Reading the full article, I see you're right. Thanks for pointing that out - I've edited my comment to reflect that.

Damn, The Promise cost $90 million? Wow - at least the proceeds from the film are going to charity (even though I'm sure it's far less than expected).
Expected drop for Fate of the Furious - I expect it to end up with at least $210-220 million domestically, which is still a great total (if far less than the previous film). It's continuing to do insane business overseas, though.
Very nice drop for Going in Style - only a 20% drop, and it outgrossed Unforgettable! It's nice to see these lower-budgeted films aimed at older people doing well.

WRITING.TEXT:
That's about what I expected for Furious 8 - a little more than $6 million more than the opening weekend of Furious 6.
Furious 7 just had so many things going for it to gross $147 million - the massive interest in the wake of Paul Walker's death, great reviews, and it was advertised as "One Last Ride."
This is still a very good domestic opening, though, IMO (and it's doing insane business overseas this weekend), and it's easily going to gross $1 billion+ worldwide.
Damn, that's an amazing number. It could beat the opening worldwide record of The Force Awakens! Universal is going to be making these movies for a long time.
